                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                focus on the issue search field<span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    c<kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                compose a new issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    s<kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  :
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                star the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    ?<kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>

                <span class="key-shortcut">

                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      Chrome Version: 96.0.4656.2 Canary<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 96.0.4656.2 Canary<!----></span><br>Operating System: All<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: All<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>Similar to <span class="line"><!---->Similar to <!----></span>issue 1215029<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1215029" title="Security: UAF when sending tab to device"><!---->issue 1215029<!----></a><br><br>2. Open chrome Sign into it with an account that's used with at least two other device<span class="line"><!---->2. Open chrome Sign into it with an account that's used with at least two other device<!----></span><br>3. Install the extension.<span class="line"><!---->3. Install the extension.<!----></span><br>4. the extension will open a new window with two tabs.<span class="line"><!---->4. the extension will open a new window with two tabs.<!----></span><br>5. Right-click on the first page<span class="line"><!---->5. Right-click on the first page<!----></span><br>6. Select "Share" >> "Send to your adives" and wait. Crash!<span class="line"><!---->6. Select "Share" &gt;&gt; "Send to your adives" and wait. Crash!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
      
        
      <div>
        
      </div>

        by

        I think it's a destruction order bug, basically.<span class="line"><!---->I think it's a destruction order bug, basically.<!----></span><br><br>send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::UpdateIcon(), called by<span class="line"><!---->send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::UpdateIcon(), called by<!----></span><br>send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleViewImpl::Hide(), called by<span class="line"><!---->send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleViewImpl::Hide(), called by<!----></span><br>send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::~SendTabToSelfBubbleController(), called by<span class="line"><!---->send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::~SendTabToSelfBubbleController(), called by<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>content::WebContentsImpl::~WebContentsImpl()<span class="line"><!---->content::WebContentsImpl::~WebContentsImpl()<!----></span><br><br>and then UpdateIcon does:<span class="line"><!---->and then UpdateIcon does:<!----></span><br><br>  Browser* browser = chrome::FindBrowserWithWebContents(web_contents_);<span class="line"><!---->  Browser* browser = chrome::FindBrowserWithWebContents(web_contents_);<!----></span><br><br>but at this point, since the WebContents is being destroyed, it's already been moved from the list of all webcontentses, so browser is nullptr, and then we try to call window() on it a few lines later and die.<span class="line"><!---->but at this point, since the WebContents is being destroyed, it's already been moved from the list of all webcontentses, so browser is nullptr, and then we try to call window() on it a few lines later and die.<!----></span><br><br>We might be able to fix this by just bailing here if !browser?<span class="line"><!---->We might be able to fix this by just bailing here if !browser?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }

          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }

          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

Open chrome Sign into it with an account that's used with at least two other device<span class="line"><!---->2. Open chrome Sign into it with an account that's used with at least two other device<!----></span><br>3. Install the extension.<span class="line"><!---->3. Install the extension.<!----></span><br>4. the extension will open a new window with two tabs.<span class="line"><!---->4. the extension will open a new window with two tabs.<!----></span><br>5. Right-click on the first page<span class="line"><!---->5. Right-click on the first page<!----></span><br>6. Select "Share" >> "Send to your adives" and wait. Crash!<span class="line"><!---->6.           <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1254131#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        I think it's a destruction order bug, basically.<span class="line"><!---->I think it's a destruction order bug, basically.<!----></span><br><br>send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::UpdateIcon(), called by<span class="line"><!---->send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::UpdateIcon(), called by<!----></span><br>send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleViewImpl::Hide(), called by<span class="line"><!---->send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleViewImpl::Hide(), called by<!----></span><br>send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::~SendTabToSelfBubbleController(), called by<span class="line"><!---->send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::~SendTabToSelfBubbleController(), called by<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>content::WebContentsImpl::~WebContentsImpl()<span class="line"><!---->content::WebContentsImpl::~WebContentsImpl()<!----></span><br><br>and then UpdateIcon does:<span class="line"><!---->and then UpdateIcon does:<!----></span><br><br>  Browser* browser = chrome::FindBrowserWithWebContents(web_contents_);<span class="line"><!---->  Browser* browser = chrome::FindBrowserWithWebContents(web_contents_);<!----></span><br><br>but at this point, since the WebContents is being destroyed, it's already been moved from the list of all webcontentses, so browser is nullptr, and then we try to call window() on it a few lines later and die.<span class="line"><!---->but at this point, since the WebContents is being destroyed, it's already been moved from the list of all webcontentses, so browser is nullptr, and then we try to call window() on it a few lines later and die.<!----></span><br><br>We might be able to fix this by just bailing here if !browser?<span class="line"><!---->We might be able to fix this by just bailing here if !browser?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Thanks for your report, Khalil, however, as this bug appears to be a null pointer deref rather than a UAF, it is not considered a security bug and we therefore are unable to extend a VRP reward.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for your report, Khalil, however, as this bug appears to be a null pointer deref rather than a UAF, it is not considered a security bug and we therefore are unable to extend a VRP reward.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>

          <tbody>

        </table>

    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Reproducible without needing to install the extension (noting that crash does not occur when clicking QR code):<span class="line"><!---->Reproducible without needing to install the extension (noting that crash does not occur when clicking QR code):<!----></span><br>1. Go to any tab<span class="line"><!---->1. Go to any tab<!----></span><br>2. Right click -> Share -> Select Send to your devices<span class="line"><!---->2. Right click -&gt; Share -&gt; Select Send to your devices<!----></span><br>3. Close tab using keyboard shortcut (cmd+W)<span class="line"><!---->3. Close tab using keyboard shortcut (cmd+W)<!----></span><br><br>@ellyjones, It looks like the crash only happens if the desktop sharing hub is enabled.<span class="line"><!---->@ellyjones, It looks like the crash only happens if the desktop sharing hub is enabled.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Will disable share-context-menu for now.<span class="line"><!---->The share-context-menu is only available M96, hence removing M95 labels.           <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1254131#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Sep 29, 2021, 6:28 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1254131#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Sep 29, 2021, 6:28 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        I think it's a destruction order bug, basically.<span class="line"><!---->I think it's a destruction order bug, basically.<!----></span><br><br>send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::UpdateIcon(), called by<span class="line"><!---->send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::UpdateIcon(), called by<!----></span><br>send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleViewImpl::Hide(), called by<span class="line"><!---->send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleViewImpl::Hide(), called by<!----></span><br>send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::~SendTabToSelfBubbleController(), called by<span class="line"><!---->send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::~SendTabToSelfBubbleController(), called by<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>content::WebContentsImpl::~WebContentsImpl()<span class="line"><!---->content::WebContentsImpl::~WebContentsImpl()<!----></span><br><br>and then UpdateIcon does:<span class="line"><!---->and then UpdateIcon does:<!----></span><br><br>  Browser* browser = chrome::FindBrowserWithWebContents(web_contents_);<span class="line"><!---->  Browser* browser = chrome::FindBrowserWithWebContents(web_contents_);<!----></span><br><br>but at this point, since the WebContents is being destroyed, it's already been moved from the list of all webcontentses, so browser is nullptr, and then we try to call window() on it a few lines later and die.<span class="line"><!---->but at this point, since the WebContents is being destroyed, it's already been moved from the list of all webcontentses, so browser is nullptr, and then we try to call window() on it a few lines later and die.<!----></span><br><br>We might be able to fix this by just bailing here if !browser?<span class="line"><!---->We might be able to fix this by just bailing here if !browser?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        by

Open chrome Sign into it with an account that's used with at least two other device<span class="line"><!---->2. Open chrome Sign into it with an account that's used with at least two other device<!----></span><br>3. Install the extension.<span class="line"><!---->3. Install the extension.<!----></span><br>4. the extension will open a new window with two tabs.<span class="line"><!---->4. the extension will open a new window with two tabs.<!----></span><br>5. Right-click on the first page<span class="line"><!---->5. Right-click on the first page<!----></span><br>6. Select "Share" >> "Send to your adives" and wait. Crash!<span class="line"><!---->6.         The share-context-menu is only available M96, hence removing M95 labels. Will disable share-context-menu for now.<span class="line"><!---->The share-context-menu is only available M96, hence removing M95 labels. Will disable share-context-menu for now.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        by

        by

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1254131#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Sep 29, 2021, 6:28 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

        I think it's a destruction order bug, basically.<span class="line"><!---->I think it's a destruction order bug, basically.<!----></span><br><br>send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::UpdateIcon(), called by<span class="line"><!---->send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::UpdateIcon(), called by<!----></span><br>send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleViewImpl::Hide(), called by<span class="line"><!---->send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleViewImpl::Hide(), called by<!----></span><br>send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::~SendTabToSelfBubbleController(), called by<span class="line"><!---->send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::~SendTabToSelfBubbleController(), called by<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>content::WebContentsImpl::~WebContentsImpl()<span class="line"><!---->content::WebContentsImpl::~WebContentsImpl()<!----></span><br><br>and then UpdateIcon does:<span class="line"><!---->and then UpdateIcon does:<!----></span><br><br>  Browser* browser = chrome::FindBrowserWithWebContents(web_contents_);<span class="line"><!---->  Browser* browser = chrome::FindBrowserWithWebContents(web_contents_);<!----></span><br><br>but at this point, since the WebContents is being destroyed, it's already been moved from the list of all webcontentses, so browser is nullptr, and then we try to call window() on it a few lines later and die.<span class="line"><!---->but at this point, since the WebContents is being destroyed, it's already been moved from the list of all webcontentses, so browser is nullptr, and then we try to call window() on it a few lines later and die.<!----></span><br><br>We might be able to fix this by just bailing here if !browser?<span class="line"><!---->We might be able to fix this by just bailing here if !browser?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>

          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Not requesting merge to dev (M96) because latest trunk commit (926834) appears to be prior to dev branch point (929512). If this is incorrect, please replace the Merge-NA-96 label with Merge-Request-96. If other changes are required to fix this bug completely, please request a merge if necessary.<span class="line"><!---->Not requesting merge to dev (M96) because latest trunk commit (926834) appears to be prior to dev branch point (929512).         mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

        by

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1254131#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Sep 29, 2021, 6:28 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

        I think it's a destruction order bug, basically.<span class="line"><!---->I think it's a destruction order bug, basically.<!----></span><br><br>send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::UpdateIcon(), called by<span class="line"><!---->send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::UpdateIcon(), called by<!----></span><br>send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleViewImpl::Hide(), called by<span class="line"><!---->send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleViewImpl::Hide(), called by<!----></span><br>send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::~SendTabToSelfBubbleController(), called by<span class="line"><!---->send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::~SendTabToSelfBubbleController(), called by<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>content::WebContentsImpl::~WebContentsImpl()<span class="line"><!---->content::WebContentsImpl::~WebContentsImpl()<!----></span><br><br>and then UpdateIcon does:<span class="line"><!---->and then UpdateIcon does:<!----></span><br><br>  Browser* browser = chrome::FindBrowserWithWebContents(web_contents_);<span class="line"><!---->  Browser* browser = chrome::FindBrowserWithWebContents(web_contents_);<!----></span><br><br>but at this point, since the WebContents is being destroyed, it's already been moved from the list of all webcontentses, so browser is nullptr, and then we try to call window() on it a few lines later and die.<span class="line"><!---->but at this point, since the WebContents is being destroyed, it's already been moved from the list of all webcontentses, so browser is nullptr, and then we try to call window() on it a few lines later and die.<!----></span><br><br>We might be able to fix this by just bailing here if !browser?<span class="line"><!---->We might be able to fix this by just bailing here if !browser?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }

        by

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1254131#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Sep 29, 2021, 6:28 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

        I think it's a destruction order bug, basically.<span class="line"><!---->I think it's a destruction order bug, basically.<!----></span><br><br>send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::UpdateIcon(), called by<span class="line"><!---->send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::UpdateIcon(), called by<!----></span><br>send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleViewImpl::Hide(), called by<span class="line"><!---->send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleViewImpl::Hide(), called by<!----></span><br>send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::~SendTabToSelfBubbleController(), called by<span class="line"><!---->send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::~SendTabToSelfBubbleController(), called by<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>content::WebContentsImpl::~WebContentsImpl()<span class="line"><!---->content::WebContentsImpl::~WebContentsImpl()<!----></span><br><br>and then UpdateIcon does:<span class="line"><!---->and then UpdateIcon does:<!----></span><br><br>  Browser* browser = chrome::FindBrowserWithWebContents(web_contents_);<span class="line"><!---->  Browser* browser = chrome::FindBrowserWithWebContents(web_contents_);<!----></span><br><br>but at this point, since the WebContents is being destroyed, it's already been moved from the list of all webcontentses, so browser is nullptr, and then we try to call window() on it a few lines later and die.<span class="line"><!---->but at this point, since the WebContents is being destroyed, it's already been moved from the list of all webcontentses, so browser is nullptr, and then we try to call window() on it a few lines later and die.<!----></span><br><br>We might be able to fix this by just bailing here if !browser?<span class="line"><!---->We might be able to fix this by just bailing here if !browser?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

      Chrome Version: 96.0.4656.2 Canary<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 96.0.4656.2 Canary<!----></span><br>Operating System: All<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: All<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>Similar to <span class="line"><!---->Similar to <!----></span>issue 1215029<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1215029" title="Security: UAF when sending tab to device"><!---->issue 1215029<!----></a><br><br>2. Open chrome Sign into it with an account that's used with at least two other device<span class="line"><!---->2. Open chrome Sign into it with an account that's used with at least two other device<!----></span><br>3. Install the extension.<span class="line"><!---->3. Install the extension.<!----></span><br>4. the extension will open a new window with two tabs.<span class="line"><!---->4. the extension will open a new window with two tabs.<!----></span><br>5. Right-click on the first page<span class="line"><!---->5. Right-click on the first page<!----></span><br>6. Select "Share" >> "Send to your adives" and wait. Crash!<span class="line"><!---->6.         by

        by

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1254131#c14">Comment 14<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        I think it's a destruction order bug, basically.<span class="line"><!---->I think it's a destruction order bug, basically.<!----></span><br><br>send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::UpdateIcon(), called by<span class="line"><!---->send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::UpdateIcon(), called by<!----></span><br>send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleViewImpl::Hide(), called by<span class="line"><!---->send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleViewImpl::Hide(), called by<!----></span><br>send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::~SendTabToSelfBubbleController(), called by<span class="line"><!---->send_tab_to_self::SendTabToSelfBubbleController::~SendTabToSelfBubbleController(), called by<!----></span><br>...<span class="line"><!---->...<!----></span><br>content::WebContentsImpl::~WebContentsImpl()<span class="line"><!---->content::WebContentsImpl::~WebContentsImpl()<!----></span><br><br>and then UpdateIcon does:<span class="line"><!---->and then UpdateIcon does:<!----></span><br><br>  Browser* browser = chrome::FindBrowserWithWebContents(web_contents_);<span class="line"><!---->  Browser* browser = chrome::FindBrowserWithWebContents(web_contents_);<!----></span><br><br>but at this point, since the WebContents is being destroyed, it's already been moved from the list of all webcontentses, so browser is nullptr, and then we try to call window() on it a few lines later and die.<span class="line"><!---->but at this point, since the WebContents is being destroyed, it's already been moved from the list of all webcontentses, so browser is nullptr, and then we try to call window() on it a few lines later and die.<!----></span><br><br>We might be able to fix this by just bailing here if !browser?<span class="line"><!---->We might be able to fix this by just bailing here if !browser?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

          position: relative;

        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
